main.name: Eduardo Moreira
main.description: Innovative Internet developer and entrepreneur who strives to make the world a more united and connected place. Domain of software development, database management systems and work with different data structures

bio.bio1: I am a programmer with experience in web development, desktop applications, both relational and non-relational databases, deployment of servers on platforms such as Heroku, Godaddy (cpanel), etc.
bio.bio2: I have a good command of Git to manage the version control of my projects and good code organization. Whenever I can improve or optimize something, I do it.
bio.bio3: Despite my passion for creating videogames with Unity3D and Blender, and that in the future I would like to dedicate myself professionally to it, I focus my time on web development, considering myself a Full Stack developer. I have skills in various OS, programming languages, data structures and algorithms, and both front-end and back-end frameworks.
bio.bio4: I specialize in the MERN development stack, since I love working with the technologies that compose it. I adapt quickly to any technology, learning everything that is necessary in a very short time.

main.contactmessage: You can contact me through the following form.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: At the moment I am studying the 4th year of my specialty. I have acquired most of my knowledge in school, although I have learned many things in a self-taught way.

work.title: Layout, design and programming
work.description: The work consisted of creating a virtual platform where professionals and clients could register. Professionals could rent offices to carry out sessions, while clients created appointments to meet with specialists in those offices. For this project I used ReactJs to create the frontend, Redux to handle the application statuses, Material UI for the styles, Axios to make the requests to an API-REST that I used as a back-end server, for this I used Node + Express, and as database, Mongodb.

work.title: Programming and maintenance
work.description: The objective of the project was to develop a website where clients could enter and pass a series of psychological tests to find out their mental state. It was my first job with php and it took me a bit of work, but I learned a lot about that wonderful programming language, as well as the framework used (Laravel). As a database I used MariaDB.

work.title: Programming
work.description: I have acquired most of my knowledge with personal projects. Among these I have some video games, both single player and online; a text editor created in assembly language very similar to VIM, which I call VIM-ASM; some desktop applications, created with WindowsForm (C #), WPF, ElectronJs, Tkinter (Python), etc.; web pages in different technologies, both front-end and back-end; and console applications in various programming languages (C, C #, PHP, JS (Node), TS, Python, F #, etc.). Since Git came into my life, I manage all the versions of my projects with this wonderful tool. I have learned how to deploy servers in the cloud efficiently, as well as various tools to do it. I am from the group of obscure programmers who use any Linux distro. I have a medium-advanced level of Bash; and almost everything I have learned has been self-taught, with the help of man's best friend, the Internet.
